{"id":438206528,"lang":"java","time":"1 year, 1 month","timestamp":1609720308,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"1 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/438206528/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"39.3 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * public class ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode next;\n *     ListNode() {}\n *     ListNode(int val) { this.val = val; }\n *     ListNode(int val, ListNode next) { this.val = val; this.next = next; }\n * }\n */\nclass Solution {\n    public ListNode addTwoNumbers(ListNode l1, ListNode l2) {\n        ListNode head = new ListNode(0), curr = head;\n        int carry = 0, sum = 0;\n\n        while(l1 != null || l2 != null) {\n            int x = l1 != null ? l1.val : 0;\n            int y = l2 != null ? l2.val : 0;\n            \n            sum = x + y + carry;\n            carry = sum / 10;\n            \n            curr.next = new ListNode(sum % 10);\n            curr = curr.next;\n\n            if (l1 != null) l1 = l1.next;\n            if (l2 != null) l2 = l2.next;\n        }\n        \n        if (carry > 0) {\n            curr.next = new ListNode(carry);\n        }\n        \n        return head.next;\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers"}
